meanings.sent1: I saw him smoking a doob behind the school.
meanings.sent2: She passed around a doob at the party last night.
meanings.sent3: The doob was passed around like a hot potato.
meanings.sent4: The sweet smell of the doob filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The doob was rolled perfectly, ready to be lit.

meanings.sent2: They always doob in the park on weekends.
meanings.sent3: He tried to doob discreetly behind the shed.
meanings.sent4: She felt relaxed after they doobed together.
meanings.sent5: Doobing under the stars felt magical.

meanings.sent1: Don't be such a doob and listen to me.
meanings.sent2: She called him a doob for forgetting his keys again.
meanings.sent3: The doob thought he could fly like a bird.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a lost doob in the big city.
meanings.sent5: The doob's antics always made everyone laugh.
